On that note I'm wondering if the Aatrox line is more about Illaoi understanding Aatrox as a being and his motivations. "We know your true name" isn't so much Aatrox having a name he's not telling people (even though that might be a thing), but more of a "We know what you are and what you truly want" kinda deal. I understand you, thus I don't fear you is the vibe I'm getting.
{{champion:266}} makes others give into bloodlust and feeds off of that (from what I can tell).  Illaoi knows his power and knows not to give in.

By "true name" she actually means what his weaknesses are. A name is usually an indicator that you know something and can thus understand and defeat it. If a creature has no name, it becomes much scarier and seemingly unbeatable because you don't know about it.

Illaoi knowing Aatrox's "true name" means that she knows more about him, thus she knows how to combat and resist his power.

Personally I really want to see Jax fight Aatrox.  Jax is suppose to be this beyond legendary warrior (though he's also a nameless mercenary, which I also like) and Aatrox is someone who thrives with war, with fighting.  He could see Jax as one of the ultimate challenges.  Heck he should be itching to fight Jax.

One thing that I'd find interesting is if Jax was someone whose presence ended confrontation.  Aatrox shows up to help the losing side, but he prolongs the conflict until it has run its course.  Jax shows up and ends it.

I don't know.  Really I'm just spitballing.  Before the retcon I had a headcannon where Jax was an agent of the IoW (Maybe even the grand summoner) secretly working to keep things working.  I had a story idea involving the void invading (which starts with Cho'gath deciding his bored with the league now and breaks out) which leads Jax and a bunch of other IoW champions tasked to not only stopping the void, but uniting every faction they can to fight them.

I'm rambling at this point.  I do hope they make Jax an ancient warrior when they write the new lore.  An immortal warrior that travels the world, remembered and forgotten over the course of a thousand years, and turning the tides of battles?  Jax and Aatrox can fit this concept well.

Sorry to say it, but Jax was an "unremarkable soldier-for-hire" before joining the League. He wasn't special, and was only powerful because he was against champions like Annie and Blitzcrank who were very much plausible to beat. Aatrox, however, is essentially a god of war. He thrives on conflict, and his existence revolves around it. Jax would stand no chance.

Being an unremarkable warrior for hire doesn't he was bad at combat. He could have been bad at following orders (which given his ego is plausible). Plus Master Yi was a champion during that time as well. 

New champions aren't automatically stronger than previous ones. Illaoi isn't lore wise stronger than Kindred. 

Plus we're talking about a lore retcon. For all we know, The Darkin aren't a thing, Annie's parents are no longer from Noxus, TF never dated Eve, and Jax could be an immortal figure that really gets noticed every few centuries before disappearing again.

Jax doesn't show that kind of ancient wisdom or age through his speech, though. He's arrogant, rash, and overall a jerk (kind of). Figures like Aatrox, Anivia, Lissandra, Azir, Zilean, Nasus, and Maokai are all refined in their speech and choose their words carefully. If Jax was ancient, he would know better and wouldn't be all "come at me bro" in true Brolaf fashion.

Although, Renekton is an exception to that rule, but he's kind of insane, so there's that.
